Chinese Culture

Artifact

This page is home to the artifact I have chosen to represent Chinese culture. Presenting: 小炒肉 (Xiǎo chǎo ròu), a popular stir-fried pork dish from Hunan province. This dish is known for its bold flavors, combining tender pork slices with fresh green peppers, garlic, and fermented black beans. The use of chili peppers gives it a spicy kick, characteristic of Hunan cuisine. Xiǎo chǎo ròu is not only a delicious representation of Chinese culinary art but also reflects the cultural emphasis on balance and harmony in flavors. It is a staple in many Chinese households and is often enjoyed with steamed rice, making it a beloved comfort food across China.
